translated: Now, in order to show the going-for-refuge Precept, the following is begun: â€œThen the Blessed Oneâ€ . Herein, the word-by-word commentary is this: Muttaha means I am freed. Caran means the going-for-alms round, the meaning being that the going-for-alms round is the going in due course to villages, towns, and royal cities. Caratha means go, going a league a day. Ma ekena dve agamittha means when two have gone by one path, one has to stand about while the other teaches the True Idea, so he said thus. Adi-kalyana means good, fair, excellent, at the beginning. Likewise in the middle and at the end. And this is twofold as the Dispensation and as the teaching. Herein, virtue is the beginning of the Dispensation, and quiet and insight are its middle, and the path is its end.

In brief, there are thirteen factors: color, odor, flavor, nutritive essence, origination, continuance, decay, impermanence, eye sensitivity, life faculty, bodily intimation, vocal intimation, and the eye faculty. In detail, there are thirty-six factors: the four elements, color, odor, flavor, nutritive essence, origination, continuance, decay, impermanence, life faculty, bodily intimation, vocal intimation, eye sensitivity, and the eye faculty. These are the thirteen factors. The four elements are each threefold, making twelve. The eye sensitivity is threefold, making fifteen. The life faculty is threefold, making eighteen. Bodily intimation is threefold, making twenty-one. Vocal intimation is threefold, making twenty-four. The eye faculty is threefold, making twenty-seven. The four derived entities are each threefold, making thirty-six.
